alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 13 at 9:17PM AKST until January 14 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST FRIDAY FRIDAY FROM PORTAGE TO THE HOPE CUTOFF... * WHAT...Heavy snow likely. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 18 inches in Turnagain Pass. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph through Portage Valley. * WHERE...Along the Seward Highway from near Portage to the Hope Cutoff, including Turnagain Pass. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult due to heavy, wet snow through Turnagain Pass. Heavy, wet snow is also expected along the Seward highway from Seward northward Thursday evening through the overnight hours. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A mix of rain and heavy wet snow will occur in Seward. Urban areas with snow covered roads will likely see ponding of water and potentially hazardous travel conditions.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
